intro: Cabralea multijuga, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood or cabralea. It is a flowering plant native to Brazil, belonging to the Rubiaceae family. The plant is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and produces small, white, clustered flowers. Its wood is highly valued for its rich color and durability, though it is now protected due to overharvesting. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
